title: Five of Swords Meaning - Tarot Card Meanings

keywords.raw_section:
Upright Keywords
Reversed Keywords
arguments, disputes, aggression, bullying, intimidation, conflict, hostility, stress
reconciliation, resolution, compromise, revenge, regret, remorse, cutting losses
Skip to Upright Meaning
Skip to Reversed Meaning

Comparing the Five of Swords across different tarot decks.

description: The Five of Swords card depicts a young man who has a very convenient look of contempt on his face. He is looking at the enemies that he has managed to conquer. There are five swords that he possesses – which he has taken from the other combatants who are in the card. The two other figures are walking away from him in a slow manner with a sense of loss and sadness. Above them, the sky is tumultuous and cloudy, which indicates that not everything is well, despite the fact that the battle is already over.

upright.overview:
This card indicates that you are engaging in a conflict of some nature. It can also suggest a disagreement with others, which leads to hostility and tension. Despite the fact that you think you’ve won, you might still lose in the big picture, because you have annoyed or hurt those that you have argued with, and as a result, you are on the road to isolating yourself. Perhaps, at the moment, you believed that it was more important to be right rather than appreciate and understand where the other side was coming from.
Right now, it's important to attempt to pick up the pieces. You still have the chance to act while the conflict is still fresh. You may feel as if everyone and everything is against you. You might also lose some friends along the way. This is why you will need to make a significant decision about your point of view. What is more important to you? Mutual progress, or winning? This might require you to stand up to a conflict within yourself.

What is more important to you? Mutual progress, or winning?

The card represents ambition in a way which is rather negative. Too much ambition without actual regard to the consequences or the people that you affect is never something good. Misplaced ambition such as the one depicted by this card can leave you as a dejected loser or a callous winner – in both cases, the connotation is rather negative. This card instead asks us to be more considerate of those that we surround ourselves with, to let go of ego.
upright.love_meaning: Unexpected change and uneasy energy can be signaled by the 5 of Swords tarot love meaning. There can be an anxious and demanding feeling in the air, making it easy for arguments and fights to materialize. You and your partner may feel irritable, and without taking some care, conflicts can be easy to start. Should you find yourself in one of these, you should think carefully about your reasons for being in this squabble, and make sure that you’re not arguing simply for the sake of being right. Egos may push you and your loved one to clash without any real reason. Sometimes, this can create passion when it is sorely needed, but can be damaging should it continue.
upright.career_meaning: Conflicts are erupting at work, and considerable amounts of hostility is in the air. It can be easy right now for arguments to explode. This can come from misunderstandings, lack of communication, or poor leadership. The 5 of Swords can also signal bullying and intimidation. Whether it’s you or another person, you may be called upon to stand up for yourself or someone else. While it can be tempting, ensure that you handle the matter professionally, and don’t be afraid to pull in HR if you need to. Processes are usually in place to handle these situations. However, this card can equally point towards self-victimizing, meaning that your impression of the situation may be what is causing these conflicts in the first place. Defensive behavior usually creates a cycle of aggression, so be very clear with your own actions and how they affect this environment.
upright.finances_meaning: You may be facing conflicts when it comes to money right now; whether it is with your partner, your family, or your friends. You’ll need to be extra cautious with your finances right now, especially when it comes to trusting others. There may be people who are attempting to take more from you than they are owed, or take advantage of you. Sometimes this card can also point to finances being tight right now; you may have to cut some luxurious expenses from your budget.
upright.as_feelings:
The upright Five of Swords reveals a sense of conflict and tension. This person may feel a competitive edge in your relationship, prompting them to question their own motives and emotions. They could be grappling with resentment or defensiveness, sensing the need to shield themselves from potential hurt.
On your end, the Five of Swords highlights an internal struggle where you might feel defeated or misunderstood. You could be wrestling with feelings of betrayal or disappointment, aware that communication has faltered between you two. It urges you to confront these emotions honestly and reflect on whether clinging to past grievances is worth the emotional toll it takes on both of you.
upright.as_actions: When you draw the Five of Swords, you’re being asked to take a moment to reassess your current conflicts and confrontations. This card encourages you to adopt a new perspective, recognizing that winning at all costs may not be worth the emotional toll it takes on you or others. Focus on resolving disputes through open communication rather than aggression. In practical terms, consider reaching out to someone with whom you've had disagreements; initiate a calm conversation aimed at understanding their viewpoint. Additionally, reflect on your own motivations in these situations and prioritize collaboration over competition for healthier relationships moving forward.
upright.love: tension, conflict, arguments, fights, irritability, wanting to be right
upright.career: workplace bully, intimidation, defensive attitudes, hostility
upright.finances: conflicts about money, being taken advantage of

reversed.overview: Reconciliation after heated tensions is possible with the reversed 5 of Swords tarot love meaning. There is a desire between you and your lover to lay down your swords and find a compromise. It is likely that wounds will still be painful even if both choose to let things go. At times, this card can indicate walking away from a lover or potential relationship, should reconciliation not be possible. Though painful, this may have been the better choice if heated arguments are happening much too often. Sometimes, it is better in the long run to cut your losses and walk away before more damage is done.
reversed.love_meaning: Reconciliation after heated tensions is possible with the reversed 5 of Swords tarot love meaning. There is a desire between you and your lover to lay down your swords and find a compromise. It is likely that wounds will still be painful even if both choose to let things go. At times, this card can indicate walking away from a lover or potential relationship, should reconciliation not be possible. Though painful, this may have been the better choice if heated arguments are happening much too often. Sometimes, it is better in the long run to cut your losses and walk away before more damage is done.
reversed.career_meaning: What was once a stressful and hostile work environment may be in the process of getting better. It seems that a resolution is possible now as everyone is ready to put down their swords. Compromises are made, and open communication is now possible again. If this doesn’t apply to you, this card can also suggest that an escalation in hostility is happening instead. If you’ve been dealing with a workplace bully, they may up their attacks towards you, sometimes even attempting to get you fired. Don’t be afraid to bring this up with your manager or HR, it’s their job to deal with these kinds of conflicts. Once you do though, make sure that your own behavior isn’t also a cause for concern. As long as you’ve handled things calmly and professionally, you can make it through.
reversed.finances_meaning: If you’ve been dealing with tense financial situations, or even fights about money, you may see these start to dissipate and relax now. If you’ve been dealing with people that have been attempting to take advantage of you financially, you may see them distance themselves from you, or even being held accountable for their actions.
reversed.as_feelings:
The arrival of the reversed Five of Swords suggests a significant transformation in how someone feels about you, revealing a shift from conflict and tension towards resolution and understanding. This person is beginning to let go of past grievances or misunderstandings, feeling more inclined to seek harmony rather than engage in battles. They may feel regret for previous harsh words or actions and are now open to reconciliation, indicating that they value your connection enough to move beyond negativity.
In terms of your own feelings, this card invites reflection on releasing anxiety or guilt associated with past conflicts. You might be experiencing a newfound sense of peace as you recognize the importance of forgiveness; both for yourself and others. This emotional clarity allows you to focus on rebuilding trust and fostering deeper connections, encouraging you to embrace vulnerability while letting go of any lingering resentment.
reversed.as_actions: When you draw the reversed Five of Swords, it’s a signal to rethink how you approach conflict and competition. Instead of engaging in battles that lead to resentment, focus on collaboration and understanding. Seek resolution rather than victory; this may involve reaching out to someone you’ve had disagreements with and initiating a conversation aimed at healing. Consider letting go of grudges or past grievances, allowing yourself to embrace forgiveness. In practical terms, dedicate time to activities that foster teamwork. Join a community project or collaborate on a creative endeavor. This approach will not only enhance your relationships but also bring you inner peace.

abyss: A young man is playing God with a defenseless, trapped butterfly. He lords a pin over the powerless insect, knowing he could pierce it in a moment. He taunts it with his haughty air and domineering attitude. A sense of superiority is easily distinguished in his features, in his smirk and nonchalant posture. We don't know exactly what his choice will be. However, it is clear that he is not to be trusted. The Five of Swords is a card about ethics in our choices. Are you or is someone else in your life acting in an ethical manner? Of course, we know based on the principle of karma that if you hurt the people around you, your victory will be short-lived and incomplete. Building your happiness on the suffering of others will never spare you from the unflinching judgments of time and reflection. Is your sense of ego and selfishness affecting the situation? Winning at all costs is not winning at all, as it leaves the playing field scattered with dashed hopes and dreams. Perhaps you should take a different approach to your current circumstance; being a one-eyed king in the land of the blind does not make you righteous or truly powerful. If you are not the one who is acting in such a manner, sometimes this card can come up when you need to put yourself first. In cases where you're being mistreated, it's crucial to remove yourself from that abusive situation. Is there someone working against your best interests?
